CORPORATION FOR PUBLIC BROADCASTING
NAMES WILLIAM E. DUKE
DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL AFFAIRS
FOR RELEASE
THURSDAY, MARCH 6, 1969
)
New York, March 5 - John W. Macy, Jr., President of the
Corporation for Public Broadcasting, today announced the
appointment of William E. Duke, Executive Assistant to
Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York, and former Washington
newspaperman, as the Corporation's Director of National
Affairs.
The Corporation for. Public Broadcasting is a nonprofit
agency, organized under Title II of the Public Broadcasting
Act of 1967 to help fund and coordinate public radio and
television broadcasting in the United States.
In his new post, Mr. Duke will work with Mr. Macy
and the Corporation management to help focus national
attention on the needs and potential of public broadcasting.
He will be based in Washington.
(MORE)
